polished_script:
HOOK: Insurance is killing more deals than bad inspections right now. [ON-SCREEN: Insurance > Bad Inspections]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You know that sinking feeling when everything's perfect ‚Äî buyer's pre-approved, inspection's clean, appraisal came in ‚Äî and then they walk anyway? [ON-SCREEN: Pre-approved ‚úì Clean Inspection ‚úì Deal Dies ‚úó] Jeff Biebuyck moves luxury properties in Calabasas and Hidden Hills, top 1% nationwide, and he's watching qualified buyers disappear at the finish line every single week. 
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's the part most agents never see coming.

INSIGHT: Here's what Jeff told me: "Insurability became an issue with affordability. We've seen a massive shift in our market." [ON-SCREEN: "Insurability = Affordability Issue"] Translation? That $2 million home now costs $25,000 a year just to insure. [ON-SCREEN: $2M Home = $25K Insurance] In fire zones, premiums tripled overnight. In flood zones, policies disappeared entirely. That's an extra $2,000 monthly payment your buyer never budgeted for. [ON-SCREEN: +$2,000/Month Surprise]

REFRAME: Which means you can't just know comps anymore ‚Äî you need to know carriers. You need to set insurance expectations before the offer, not after. Most agents deal with this during escrow. Top producers handle it during pre-approval.

CTA: "Are you having the insurance conversation before or after the offer?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Why qualified buyers are walking from perfect deals (it's not what you think) üè†üí∏
HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #Insurance #RealEstateAgent #PropertyInsurance #RealEstateTips
SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "You can't just know comps anymore ‚Äî you need to know carriers."
PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 1) Emphasize "right now" in hook with urgency 2) Slow down on the $25K insurance number for impact 3) Direct eye contact during the contrast structure in REFRAME
